Issues.Title: fix(upgrade): preserve $interval.flush when ngMocks is being used
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
The UpgradeModule wraps the AngularJS `$interval` service with some zonejs-related behaviour necessary for a hybrid app. angular-mocks also decorates `$interval` with a `flush` method for testing. Currently, the UpgradeModule does not add the $flush method (if present) on the original $interval to its wrapper. This causes an "$interval.flush is not a function" error if you are initializing the UpgradeModule in an existing angularjs test that uses angular-mocks and $interval.flush. 

(I am initializing the UpgradeModule in an angularjs test because one of the components in the code under test is now an Angular component that is being used in AngularJS with `downgradeComponent`).
 
Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?
This PR adds the `$interval.flush` method to the UpgradeModule's $interval wrapper, so existing angularjs tests that use `$interval.flush` can also use downgraded components. 

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information
I am currently looking for the correct place to introduce a test for this code.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(upgrade): preserve $interval.flush when ngMocks is being used" (#30229)

Issues.Title: How to build Cordova Web view application using Kendo Angular 7 components?
Issues.Body:
We are building an Angular 7 mobile app that will be integrated with a third party hybrid app (using standard HTML/JS technology) over which we have no control. They will call our function/app by launching a Webview (and URL) to pass control to us. Our app/functions then almost like a but in the Webview.

Generally, this is not a problem but we are trying to take advantage of the native controls that Cordova provides in a Hybrid app or access to via .

Do you have a sample app or an example or a build process on how to do this?

 It seems that it works with vanilla HTML app but not with Angular 7 app.

Thanks.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to build Cordova Web view application using Kendo Angular 7 components?" (#30228)

Issues.Title: docs: router - improve docs on the imports order of multi routing modules
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ“š Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description For the section https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/aio/content/guide/router.md#import-crisis-center-module-into-the-appmodule-routes in the router.md doc. The current text is: > Import crisis center module into the AppModule routes > As with the HeroesModule, you must add the CrisisCenterModule to the imports array of the AppModule before the AppRoutingModule: The **placement** order in the **imports array of the AppModule** shall be highlighted with a Notice or Warning, since the natural way of doing the hero tutorial is adding the crisis-center module with the crisis-center routing using the angular-cli after the app module. The angular-cli creates the import of crisis-center module after the AppRoutingModule. This will be an issue for the code. When a **Wildcard route** is defined in the **AppRoutingModule**, the wildcard route will be matched before the child route in the crisis-center routing can be matched. This happens very often wenn using the angular-cli to added submodule with routing feature. The natrual way of adding Wildcard route is in the AppRoutingModule, and then always place the AppRoutingModule after all submodule in the import array of the AppModule. The debugging of such error relating to the routes match due to the import placement order is very difficult. Thus, i suggest to improve the original doc text to hightlight this issue to prevent error in coding and improve the readers understanding of the impact of the placement order in the imports array of the angular modules. ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction ### What's the affected URL?** https://angular.io/guide/router#import-crisis-center-module-into-the-appmodule-routes ### Reproduction Steps** ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** ## ğŸ“·Screenshot ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error
## ğŸŒ Your Environment ### Browser info ### Anything else relevant?

# ğŸš€ feature request

### Relevant Package
@angular/core / docs?


### Description
Angular should support ability to quickly edit, compile and load components in the browser without complex server-side compilation.
This is possible with other languages / frameworks, including angular.js!, svelte, scala.js, and others. (see https://svelte.dev/examples, https://scalafiddle.io/)

### Describe the solution you'd like
If this is currently possible (with ivy?), please add documentation (or even an example).
Otherwise, please publish a roadmap for support or explain what is the critical issue.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
repl.it codesandbox stackblitz do manage to recreate such an experience by including code that almost replicates node's/npm's capabilities (+ some server side support).

Seems to me like an unreasonably complex, expensive (in term of dev time and maintenance),  and low-performance implementation. I want to create a website with dynamically created and edited components (i.e., IDE for specific domains). I did so in the past using iced-coffeescript+angular.js (browser-side compilation), I wish I could also write such code with Angular.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "support live editing in the browser" (#30222)

I did a simple check by replacing this:

```
  return this.http.get(filename, {responseType: 'text'})
    .subscribe(
        data => this.log(filename, data),
        error => this.logError(filename, error)
    );
```

by this:

```
  return this.http.get(filename, {responseType: 'text'})
    .pipe(
      tap( // Log the result or error
        data => this.log(filename, data),
        error => this.logError(filename, error)

```

The error went away, but I can't resolve my promise inside the tap so it's not really useful for me. Any idea what's going wrong?

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): properly tree-shake away StaticInjector
Issues.Body:
Ivy uses R3Injector, but we are currently pulling in both the StaticInjector
(View Engine injector) and the R3Injector when running with Ivy. This commit
adds an ivy switch so calling Injector.create() pulls in the correct
implementation of the injector depending on whether you are using VE or Ivy.
This saves us about 3KB in the bundle.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): properly tree-shake away StaticInjector" (#30219)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): support injection flags for provider deps without new
Issues.Body:
Previously, we were supporting injection flags for provider deps, but only
if they fit the format `new Optional()`. This commit fixes resolution of
provider deps to also support `Optional` (without the new). This keeps us
backwards compatible with what View Engine supported.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): support injection flags for provider deps without new" (#30216)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): usage strategy should detect ambiguous query usage
Issues.Body:
Currently we always just set the timing to `false` if we aren't
able to analyze a given call expression or new expression. e.g.

```ts
ngOnInit() {
  thirdPartyCallSync(() => this.query.doSomething())
}
```

In that case the `thirdPartyCallSync` function comes from the `node_modules`
and is only defined through types while there is no code for the
actual function logic that can be analyzed. This makes it impossible
to tell whether the given call expression actually causes the specified
arrow function to be executed synchronously or not. In order to be able
to make this better, we now peek into the passed arrow function and
check for a synchronous query usage. If so, we set the query timing to
static and mark it as ambiguous. This ensures that the usage strategy is
less "magical" and more correct with third-party code.

Additionally since functions like `setTimeout` are not analyzable but known
to be asynchronous, there is a hard-coded list of known functions which
shouldn't be marked as ambiguous.

Resolves FW-1214. As planned within https://hackmd.io/hPiLWpPlQ4uynC1luIBdfQ
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(core): usage strategy should detect ambiguous query usage" (#30215)

Issues.Title: Windows ngcc infinite loop
Issues.Body:
fix(ivy): handle windows drives correctly

At the moment the module resolver will end up in an infinite loop in Windows because we are assuming that the root directory is always `/` however in windows this can be any drive letter example `c:/` or `d:/` etc...

With this change we also resolve the drive letter in windows, when using `AbsoluteFsPath.from` for consistence so under `/foo` will be converted to `c:/foo` this is also needed because of relative paths with different drive letters.

test: fix ngcc unit tests in windows

```
//packages/compiler-cli/ngcc/test:test
```
Partially addresses #29785
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Windows ngcc infinite loop" (#30212)

Issues.Title: Document ng config examples
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ“š Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description The ng config --help clearly states that it allows you to > Retrieves or sets Angular configuration values in the angular.json file for the workspace and if I wish to add a simple style to existing _style_ file, I can only override the existing styles, but cannot add to it. I could not even find relevant documentation. I only tried style, but it is applicable to _scripts_ as well. ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction My sample angular.json ` projects": { "samarthya": { "root": "", "sourceRoot": "src", "projectType": "application", "prefix": "sm", "schematics": {}, "architect": { "build": { "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser", "options": { "outputPath": "dist/samarthya", "index": "src/index.html", "main": "src/main.ts", "polyfills": "src/polyfills.ts", "tsConfig": "src/tsconfig.app.json", "assets": [ "src/favicon.ico", "src/assets" ], "styles": [ "src/styles.css", "node_modules/bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css" ], ` If I execute `ng config projects.samarthya.architect.build.options.styles src/styles1.css` it overrides the existing array but will not append to it. `"styles": "src/style1.css",` is the new value it reflects I don't think `ng config projects.samarthya.architect.build.options.styles [src/style1.css, src/style2.css]` will also work. ### What's the affected URL?** https://angular.io/... ### Reproduction Steps** Issue a command to append/add to the styles list `ng config projects.samarthya.architect.build.options.styles src/styles1.css` ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** Allow options to add, delete, override the styles if not an option; change the output of the `ng config --help` command. ## ğŸ“·Screenshot ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error
## ğŸŒ Your Environment ### Browser info ### Anything else relevant?

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): support forward refs in provider deps
Issues.Body:
Currently, we are not properly resolving forward refs when they appear
in deps for providers created with the useFactory strategy. This commit
wraps provider deps in the resolveForwardRef call so the tokens are
passed into the inject function as expected.

Issues.Title: Verify that SEO works well with differential loading
Issues.Body: I tried to quickly test next.angular.io with https://search.google.com/test/mobile-friendly to ensure that SEO was not being broken, but that didn't work because of the robots.txt on next.angular.io. So I deployed the version with 8.0.0-rc.2 (#30202) updates to https://angular-io-v42.firebaseapp.com/ and tested it and got an odd error ([results link](https://search.google.com/test/mobile-friendly?id=OaQNErp9LMuHLqOvGWDvmg)): Which seems to be due to some issue with how we transpile the code or load polyfills: Can someone check what's up with this and ensure that the SEO works, and ideally works OOB for any `ng new` project created with 8.0.0 - I think that now that we have the polyfills differentialy loaded there should be no reason for `ng new` not to be SEO-compatible out of the box (no advanced stuff, just not blow up). // @petebacondarwin @filipesilva

Issues.Body: This provides a ~30% performance improvement for a hello world project.

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): avoid tslint overhead for lazy module migration
Issues.Body:
By using a pure schematic based implementation the overhead of running tslint can be removed.  This also has the benefit of allowing direct control over the files loaded and to modify files only within the schematic tree context.
For a hello world application, there was a ~20% performance improvement for the CLI migration from 7.0 to 8.0 as well as a ~10% reduction in memory usage.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): avoid tslint overhead for lazy module migration" (#14323)

Issues.Title: Older CLI versions didn't use target:es2015 so we need to update them
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [x] update ``` ### Is this a regression? No ### Description If you used an older version of the CLI, you won't get the new differential loading benefits automatically because the CLI used to create new projects with `target: es5` in the `tsconfig.json`. Example: https://github.com/StephenFluin/angular-update-guide/blob/master/src/tsconfig.app.json ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction Take an old Angular app, run `ng update @angular/cli@next @angular/core@next`. Run `ng build --prod` ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error The built files will not support differential loading. Issues.Title: 8.0.0-rc.2 ng build app named rxjs01 created with --enableIvy=true fails with 'ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 'C:/dev/tests/rxjs/package.json'
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Unknown ### Description I have created new project named `rxjs01` with Angular CLI 8.0.0-rc.2 with `--enableIvy=true` but the build with `npm run build` fails. ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction `npx @angular/cli@8.0.0-rc.2 new rxjs01 --enableIvy=true` `cd rxjs01` `npm run build` ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error 



C:\dev\tests\rxjs01>npm run build

> rxjs01@0.0.0 build C:\dev\tests\rxjs01
> ng build


Date: 2019-04-30T19:06:59.336Z
Hash: f0d98ebc5557ef47c6a6
Time: 17331ms
chunk {main} main-es5.js, main-es5.js.map (main) 614 bytes [initial] [rendered]
chunk {polyfills} polyfills-es5.js, polyfills-es5.js.map (polyfills) 398 kB [initial] [rendered]
chunk {runtime} runtime-es5.js, runtime-es5.js.map (runtime) 6.08 kB [entry] [rendered]
chunk {styles} styles-es5.js, styles-es5.js.map (styles) 16.3 kB [initial] [rendered]

ERROR in ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 'C:/dev/tests/rxjs/package.json'
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! errno 1
npm ERR! rxjs01@0.0.0 build: `ng build`
npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR!
npm ERR! Failed at the rxjs01@0.0.0 build script.
npm ERR! This is probably not a problem with npm. There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     C:\Users\Svincho\AppData\Roaming\npm-cache\_logs\2019-04-30T19_06_59_432Z-debug.log
It looks like it does not like the name `rxjs01` for a project created with `--enableIvy=true`. For some reason build process tries to find `package.json` file in non-existing folder (`...rxjs/package.json` instead of `...rxjs01/package.json`). If I do exactly the same but with another name say `ivy01`, the build process completes successfully. If I do not use `--enableIvy=true` then a project with name `rxjs01` can build successfully. So to summarize: `npx @angular/cli@8.0.0-rc.2 new rxjs01 --enableIvy=true` `cd rxjs01` `npm run build` `Build fails with ERROR in ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 'C:/dev/tests/rxjs/package.json'` `npx @angular/cli@8.0.0-rc.2 new ivy01 --enableIvy=true` `cd ivy01` `npm run build` `Build succeeds` `npx @angular/cli@8.0.0-rc.2 new rxjs01` `cd rxjs01` `npm run build` `Build succeeds` And this is the full npm error log mentioned in the npm error output:

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/cli): avoid aggressive eager command loading
Issues.Body:
Currently, upon execution `ng` will load all description files and code for all available commands.  This requires a large amount of unnecessary file access and processing since only at most one command will be executed.  This change limits the loading to only the command being executed in the common case and a subset of commands in the event an alias is used.  The help command now loads all commands during its execution which is needed to gather command description information.  Further improvements are possible by only loading the necessary metadata instead of the execution code (and its dependencies) as well.
This change allows for savings of ~250ms per execution and reduces memory consumption by 10-20 MBs depending on the command.

Examples:
Before -- `./node_modules/.bin/ng version  0.99s user 0.17s system 113% cpu 1.020 total`
After -- `./node_modules/.bin/ng version  0.70s user 0.13s system 110% cpu 0.749 total`

Before -- `./node_modules/.bin/ng g c a  1.91s user 0.30s system 111% cpu 1.996 total`
After -- `./node_modules/.bin/ng g c a  1.62s user 0.27s system 110% cpu 1.715 total`

Issues.Title: CLI does not respect style file extension set in schematic when generating components without specifying the project
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ Bug report

- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [X] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Is this a regression?

Unknown

### Description
My workspace has 2 projects, 'my-app' (default project) and 'my-lib'

Running 'ng g c my-component' generates with default css file extension
Running 'ng g c my-component --project=my-app' generates with the schematic set scss file

It looks like the generate command is not respecting the schematic when you do not specify the project

## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction
ng new my-app-workspace --createApplication=false --routing --style=scss

ng g application my-app --routing --style=scss

ng g library my-lib --routing --style=scss

ng g c my-component

## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error
The style file extension of the created style file for the new component is 'css', not 'scss'

## ğŸŒ Your Environment

Angular CLI: 7.3.8
Node: 10.6.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.2.14
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms

Issues.Title: build: update less-loader to version 5.0.0
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change | References |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| less-loader | dependencies | major | [`4.1.0` -> `5.0.0`](https://diff.intrinsic.com/less-loader/4.1.0/5.0.0) | [source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack-contrib/less-loader</summary>

### [`v5.0.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​500httpsgithubcomwebpack-contribless-loadercomparev410v500-2019-04-29)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/compare/v4.1.0...v5.0.0)

##### Bug Fixes

-   webpack watching does not recover after broken less is fixed ([#​289](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/issues/289)) ([f41d12e](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/commit/f41d12e))

##### Chores

-   remove old bits mentioning webpack < 4 and node < 6 ([#​286](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/issues/286)) ([012eb8f](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/commit/012eb8f))

##### Code Refactoring

-   remove deprecated compress option ([#​283](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/issues/283)) ([3d6e9e9](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/commit/3d6e9e9))

##### BREAKING CHANGES

-   remove deprecated compress option.
-   drop support for node < 6.9 and webpack < 4

</details>

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): live reload cannot be disabled
Issues.Body:
By default the application will be served with inline mode enabled. This means that a script will be inserted in your bundle to take care of live reloading.

However at the moment we are already adding these scripts in `_addLiveReload` method.

With this change we always disable this behaviour and only add it when needed via the `_addLiveReload` logic.

Eventually we should try to remove the logic and rely on webpack-dev-server interals.

Fixes #14300
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): live reload cannot be disabled" (#14301)

Issues.Title: Live reload cannot be disabled in version 8
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ Bug report ### Command ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: **7.3.8** ### Description Disabling live reload when serving an app using `ng serve --liveReload=false` fails to disable live reloading. ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction 1. Create a default application: `ng new my-app`. 2. Serve with live reload disabled: `ng serve --liveReload=false`. 3. Open the page at http://localhost:4200 4. Issues.Title: Disable sourcemaps on @angular-devkit/build-angular:server
Issues.Body: # ğŸ Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [X ] build - [X] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? I am not sure. ### Description You need to add sourceMap: false to the server builder because including the sourcemaps on each page, causes alot of overhead, Facebook is not able to see past the first MB on a site, and adding an extra 100 KB on top of Material already loading in SSR, is just going to cause bundle sizes to be huge for no reason, I ask that you include this in the angular.json file. "server": { "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:server", "options": { "outputPath": "dist/server", "main": "src/main.server.ts", "sourceMap": false, "tsConfig": "src/tsconfig.server.json" }, "configurations": { "production": { "fileReplacements": [ { "replace": "src/environments/environment.ts", "with": "src/environments/environment.prod.ts" } ] } } ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction Set up a new SSR project using the steps in the angular.io, then take a look at the angular.json ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error You will not see an error, ## ğŸŒ Your Environment Angular CLI: 7.3.6 Node: 10.15.3 OS: darwin x64 Angular: 7.2.10 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... http, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic ... platform-server, router, service-worker Package Version ----------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.13.6 @angular-devkit/build-angular 0.13.6 @angular-devkit/build-optimizer 0.13.6 @angular-devkit/build-webpack 0.13.6 @angular-devkit/core 7.3.6 @angular-devkit/schematics 7.3.6 @angular/cdk 7.3.5 @angular/cli 7.3.6 @angular/fire 5.1.0 @angular/material 7.3.5 @angular/pwa 0.13.6 @ngtools/webpack 7.3.6 @schematics/angular 7.3.6 @schematics/update 0.13.6 rxjs 6.4.0 typescript 3.2.4 webpack 4.29.0 **Anything else relevant?** This was a very hard issue for me to debug, if you are using SSR, and wondering why certain sites can see your meta tags, and others can't, it's probably because of the inclusion of sourcemaps could be breaking their file size limits.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Disable sourcemaps on @angular-devkit/build-angular:server" (#14304)

Issues.Title: e2e respects publilcHost, but serve changes publicHost setting
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [x] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? I dont know ### Description As it is now, e2e command is respecting the `publicHost` setting from serve command, and based on that it sets the baseUrl which is used by tests: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/76492141d21649e1924a7a84a2af25ceca294be1/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/protractor/index.ts#L123-L131 However, the serve command itself modifies this value, and is getting rid of everything in the path, other than host: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/76492141d21649e1924a7a84a2af25ceca294be1/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/dev-server/index.ts#L154 Is it possible for the serve command to keep the configuration option intact? This way the `baseUrl` for e2e test run will be created correctly. Alternatively, the value of `baseUrl` option passed in protractor config could be respected, and concatenated with the calculated host from `publicHost` option. However, this way there is duplicate configuration: base url will be specified both for serve command and for e2e command. ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction To reproduce, set the serve configuration options as following: ```json "options": { "browserTarget": "myapp:build", "baseHref": "/custom-namespace/", "publicHost": "https://localhost/custom-namespace/" } ``` Then run `ng e2e`. ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error The browser will open with URL: `https://localhost/` instead of `https://localhost/custom-namespace/` ## ğŸŒ Your Environment It seems that my environment is older compared to the latest commit in this repository. However, it seems that the behaviour is largely similar, and `publicHost` is modified in the same way in older and newer versions.

Issues.Title: mat-menu: In IE, mat-menu-panel with xPosition before and vertical scrollbar shifts to the left and doesn't align correctly
Issues.Body:
#### Overview
Menus with too many menu items in them will cause the mat-menu-panel with xPosition="before" to shift to the left and not line up correctly with the right edge of the button in IE browser. Consequently, if you add a set max-height to the mat-menu-panel to override the default 100vh calculation, the panel is still shifted to the left in IE. 

#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: Bug


#### What is the expected behavior?
mat-menu with xPosition="before" shouldn't shift left and should align correctly to the right even if the number of menu items exceed the max-height of panel in IE.

#### What is the current behavior?
mat-menu with xPosition="before" and menu items that exceed max-height of panel causes the panel to shift to the left and not align with button in IE.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
[StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-c4k7nt)

Add enough items to mat-menu with xPosition="before" until menu panel exceeds max-height. 

Screenshot shows correct behavior in FF and Chrome. Incorrect behavior is seen in last screen in IE:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17503018/57039707-f5cc3700-6c22-11e9-9299-189046dbd2dd.png)

Screenshot shows incorrect behavior in IE when overriding max-height as well:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17503018/57039757-244a1200-6c23-11e9-8671-7083c4f2c522.png)

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Menus should display consistently across all browsers for consistent user experience. 

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Windows
Angular: 7.0.3
Material: 7.0.4
TypeScript: 3.1.6
Browsers: IE only
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-menu: In IE, mat-menu-panel with xPosition before and vertical scrollbar shifts to the left and doesn't align correctly" (#15934)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-n-drop): ignore consecutive touchmove events on drag item on multitouch
Issues.Body:
Bumped into an inconsistent behaviour on multitouch. Currently the DragDropRegistry is designed atop of Set, and assumes there could be only one pointer active on item. Which is not true for multitouch devices.  

So thereâ€™re two ways to fix it:
1. Teach DragDropRegistry to respect multiple simultaneous pointers on one item.
2. Stick to Set as designed initially, respect only the first pointer on item, and properly ignore all consecutive pointers.

The first way looks much more promising, but requires much more effort and requires attention of core team, I suppose. The second one is not that flexible, but is still more consistent than the current implementation. So this commit implements the second way.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-n-drop): ignore consecutive touchmove events on drag item on multitouch" (#15923)

Issues.Title: Dynamic steps with form validity checks not working with stepper component
Issues.Body:
I am struggling to get a dynamic behavior for a component which uses a `mat-vertical-stepper`.

Essentially, a particular step should be removable in case some required data is already available which would render it redundant.

The main idea would be to use `*ngIf` on a `mat-step` element:

```html
<mat-step *ngIf="requirePersonalInfo">
  <!-- .. -->
</mat-step>
```

which essentially works but it seems this does not work if we use the built-in error checking.

Here is an example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-5hds7p?file=app%2Fstepper-errors-example.html

Before clicking the checkbox on top, it is not possible to move to the second step. After clicking it however, inserts the second step but does not prevent me from moving to the next step anymore.

> Also: Unchecking the checkbox results in two form being rendered at once. The step 2 form slides in from the right while the step 1 form is still visible.

Here is the same stepper but *without* any dynamic behavior just to show that it works as such: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-5hds7p-a9nsv7?file=app/stepper-errors-example.html

My current workaround is to set all elements as touched after the user clicked on "next" and check if the form is valid: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-5hds7p-1agpxc?file=app%2Fstepper-errors-example.html

I have seen https://github.com/angular/components/issues/11791 and https://github.com/angular/components/pull/9132 but I don' think they are related.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dynamic steps with form validity checks not working with stepper component" (#15919)

Issues.Title: feat(popover-edit): accessible row hover content
Issues.Body:
Hover content is now additionally shown when the row has focus or an active edit.
Further, to maintain sane tab ordering, the first and last rows as well as the rows immediately above and below the currently focused row are kept in the dom but are visually hidden.

The mat-hover-content directive now works properly in non-editable table cells.

Also includes some optimizations to event/observable usage at startup that reduce startup latency by about 40ms with 500 rows and 2 edits per row.
Savings will be higher when there are more edits per row.
Improved how we re-enter the NgZone to trigger far fewer calls to ApplicationRef.tick (performance improvement will vary by app).

Issues.Title: Autocomplete selection with mouse focusing body
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

When I select an option via mouse click, it should focus the input element. This works correctly when navigating to correct option with arrow keys and pressing enter.

The issue is that if I present the autocomplete within a dropdown or dialog element that closes when a click/focus is detected outside of itself, the drop down/dialog will close everytime a mat autocomplete option is selected via mouse.

#### What is the current behavior?
after a mouse selection behave the same way as a keyboard/enter selection. Dont focus the body just send focus back to input.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

styling is shit obviously but start typing a city in the drop down, if you key down and press enter you'll notice the drop down doesn't close. but if you use mouse to select it does close.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/create-shvowk?file=app%2Fapp.component.ts

Issues.Title: Spinner going back of the mat dialog
Issues.Body:
#### 
We are using progress spinner for every API call.  And we registered spinner at the app module level. **When we want spinner on dialog the spinner hiding back of the popup**.

To fix this we are adding spinner tag in every dialog component HTML. even z index also not working here.  we have tried mat progress spinner and other spinners as well but no use. 

Can we have a solution for this issue?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Spinner going back of the mat dialog" (#15911)
